title: Palindromes
content:
Hi there,

Can someone help me, I saw an article ages ago on Typophile about Palindromes but cannot now find it, any ideas?

Cheers

Matt

I think I know what you are talking about, and after skimming the web I have found a name for it. You must be referring to glass-door ambigrams!

[http://www.maths.monash.edu.au/~bpolster/i.html#glass](http://web.archive.org/web/20071129212422/http:/www.maths.monash.edu.au/~bpolster/i.html#glass "http://www.maths.monash.edu.au/~bpolster/i.html#glass")
Some sort of ambigram, at least. I can’t find him now but there is a calligrapher who does these in fine style. I remember a nice one he made for the band Aerosmith. . .

Hi Matt,  
mmmh, I’m not sure what exactly you’re loooking for, but there are [10 results when searching typophile.com for ‘palindrome’](http://web.archive.org/web/20071129212422/http:/www.google.com/search?q=site:typophile.com%20Palindrome)

<cite>I am also looking for any info on illustrative text that is not a palindrome but does read backwards and forwards, if that makes sense</cite>  
Are you talking about [ambigrams](http://web.archive.org/web/20071129212422/http:/www.google.com/search?q=site:typophile.com%20ambigram)?
the palindrome of Bolton is... Notlob

I was indeed talking about Palindromes, thatnks guys, always a help..
